div1.p: In this handwritten draft, [Kean] states that an introductory paragraph should be inserted before listing the Yellow Fever Roll of Honor in the Army Register. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Memorandum from [Jefferson Randolph Kean] to the Adjutant General, March 1930
div1.p:
Memo for Adjt Gen US Army
March 31
1930

In re: Yellow Fever Roll of Honor pub. in Army Register
annually.

An introductory paragraph which would state briefly why the
Roll is published and quoting the admirable statement
of the Secretary of War Hon Elihu Root in his annual
report for the year 1902 (page 10) with regar reference
to the work of the Reed Board would add much
to the dignity and literary value of this official
recognition. I am aware that the Act of Congress
is referred to I at the other end of the volume, but
this need not prevent another reference to it in this
appropriate connection. There is sufficient space
for this statement without exceeding the three pages
now allowed to it. A draft of the introductory
paragraph is attached.

March 25
1930
A.G. agreed to add it to roll of Honor in 1931
